result.markdown: --- title: "Using Python in CBS remote access environment" description: | Some tips for using Python in CBS remote access environment (RA). categories: - prediction - guide author: - "Lisa Sivak" - "Gert Stulp" date: '2024-07-14' toc: true image: ../../images/cbs_pick_python.jpg image-alt: LISS logo. language: section-title-footnotes: References --- ## Current Python environment It is impossible to install packages yourself inside the CBS RA since it's cut off from the external Internet. CBS can install environment using the requirements file. You can download the requirements file below to see which packages and versions are currently installed (python version is 3.10). This environment will be automatically activated when you load python prompt (see instructions below) - you don't have to activate it. If you need other packages, please create a new requirements file following instructions below and send it to us. It is possible to install several different environments (then you'll need to activate and deactivate them using 'conda deactivate' and 'conda activate env' commands in Python prompt). Download environment9469.txt ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html} ``` ::: ::: ## How to create Python environment You need to create the environment outside the RA, in Python on __Windows__, using Mambaforge installed in C:\\mambaforge. Follow the steps below to generate a txt file and send it to us. 1. On your own Windows system in Python, create a new environment named after the project code (9469) plus your 4-letter RA username and activate it. As an example, we use 9469user. a.`conda create –n 9469user` b.`conda activate 9469user` 2. Install pip. `conda install pip` 3. Then, install the required packages with pip. `pip install package_name` 4. Export the environment with pip. a. `pip freeze > C:\temp\environment0000user.txt` b. Check that the file does not contain references to local paths (file://). c. If it does, use the following command: 'pip list --format=freeze > C:\\temp\\environment0000user.txt' 5. Test the environment by removing and recreating it. a.`rd /q /s \envs\0000user` b. `conda create –n 0000user` c. `conda activate 0000user` d. `conda install pip` e. `pip install –r C:\temp\environment0000user.txt` f. Test the Python environment. ## How to start Jupyter Notebook In the search bar, type Python prompt and open it. Then run the command below. It will open Jupyter Notebook. Change drive (e.g., to F:) if you want to access another drive. 'C:\\mambaforge\\envs\\9469\\Scripts\\jupyter-notebook.exe --notebook-dir="H:\\' Photo by Nastya Dulhiier on Unsplash
